item.content:encoded:
Twitter is one of the most popular social media platforms. Recent purchase and changes in its leadership concerned many Twitter users as they moved away from it and migrated to other Fediverse platforms like Mastodon.

I have been a Twitter user since 2015, and while I was not an active user all the time, it was an online environment in which I cloud connect with friends and people I met in real life and share moments with them. Because Twitter is FREE and not charging users for the service, it comes with ads. However, numerous third-party legal apps are developed that let you access Twitter feeds without seeing ads and distractions, and Twitter’s API provides this.

Last Thursday, Twitter revoked API access to those apps like Tweetbot without proper notice or official announcement. And worse, when the developers reached Twitter on the issue, the feedback was absolute silence, even not a single word from Mr. Musk. It is a speculation that Twitter ‘intentionally’ blocked those apps.

As John Gruber nicely wrote:

Twitter can of course do what it wants, and Musk owns Twitter so he can do what he wants. But pulling the plug on these clients and ghosting everyone on communications about it is so absurdly disrespectful. Zero respect for the users for those apps, zero respect for the developers behind them — many of whom had been building on the Twitter platform for 10-15 years. Just a clown show.

I have been using Tweetbot since 2016, but it stopped working last Thursday.

It is time to use open platforms and self-hosted social networking services like Mastodon. I deactivated my Twitter account, and sorry to miss contact with friends. You can now find me here.

item.content:encoded:
DNA extraction from fresh and young spring leaves is easy using the inexpensive CTAB method or expensive column kits. However, when it comes to DNA extraction from degraded autumn tree leaves, pre-wash before the CTAB step is required to get rid of the secondary compounds, which pass through to the final stages. The results would be genomic DNA contaminated with polysaccharides, polyphenols, etc.

Ulmus autumn leaves

I tried TNE (Tris, NaCl, EDTA) buffer as a pre-wash before CTAB for Ulmus species, but DNA was not precipitating well enough after keeping overnight at -20C. And quality, according to the NanoDrop, was not good either.

Washing with Sorbitol instead of TNE improved the yield and quality of genomic DNA but could have been better. This method is described in detail in the Inglis et al. 2018. I repeated both washes twice to discard the viscous supernatant.

Samples in Isopropyl alcohol (TNE pre-wash)

Samples in Isopropyl alcohol (Sorbitol pre-wash)

More compounds (e.g., polysaccharides, polyphenolics) were carried over to this step using TNE compared to Sorbitol. This is visible in the agarose 1% gel images. The ladder is 1 kb.

After Sorbitol wash

After TNE wash

There is room for improvement, though. If you have to extract DNA from autumn leaves, try sorbitol wash! Other options would be from buds, cambium, or woods.

item.title: Diversity of Life
For Iranian Women - برای زنان ایران
item.description: Recent incidents about the deaths of people in Iran are disturbing. Killing, arresting, and threatening people is not how to treat Iran’s brave women and men. What a shame to arrest Taraneh Alidoosti, a citizen, mom of a nine-year-old daughter, and award-winning actress. It is cowardly to shut internet access and block common communication apps aiming to isolate people from each other and the rest of the world. I am deeply upset about the current situation and stand with the people.

item.title: Welcome - First post
item.description: With the plethora of ‘free’ and ‘social’ platforms for microblogging, a need for a personal blog or website seems redundant. I firmly believe in having an independent platform and not relying on ad-promoted giants. A private domain costs a few bucks annually, and hosting a website is easy and quick that can be done locally or on paid servers. This static website has zero analytics, ads, or other nonsense. It should be responsive and fast on desktop or mobile.
